text:
Spectre update to chrome is rolling out. Expect slowness. 
<https://www.howtogeek.com/fyi/google-chrome-will-start-using-10-more-ram-now-thanks-to-spectre/>
This is great news, I was feeling guilty for having so much unused RAM.
which also means the next version of slack will use even more RAM - sweet!
Just get an extra stick for slack and an extra one for chrome
good thing apple just updated their macbook pros
It’s funny because I was feeling the same way! Upgraded to 40gb with my new comp and I was like _“No wayyyyy I’ll use this”_
There are kids in third world countries that don’t have ANY ram, and we’re just wasting it all!
Does anyone know if having a user select their geographic region and keeping it in localStorage is a GDPR issue?
as long as the user knows that its getting saved, you should be fine
My thought was that it wouldn’t be affected by the law because the information is stored client-side but maybe the canned HS GDPR opt-in covers that already.
